column1: Tolkien commented on the "[[wikipedia:Atomic bombings of Hiroshima and Nagasaki
column2: Atomic bombs]]", and denounced such tactics as "utter folly". With both moral and intellectual decline, such weaponry in the hands of men would not be very wise. But if all went well, Japan would cave in. Tolkien ended the fragment with the statement that we are all in God's hands, and God does not look kindly on Babel-builders.
